intro: Picris hispidissima, commonly known as hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed, alternate leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
